column1: The Bent World was a name describing the condition of Arda after the destruction of Númenor and the removal of Valinor in the late Second Age; after this
column2: the world was made bent (or round) and only the Elves could still follow the Straight Road to the Undying Lands.

column1: :See also: Round World version of the Silmarillion.
In Tolkiens writings as published in the later volumes of The History of Middle-earth
column2: Arda was a round world from its beginning
column3: and the idea of a flat world was instead an invention of the Númenóreans. Thus
column5: the world would not need to be bent at the time of Númenors downfall and Amans removal from the physical world.
